summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 6, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in continuous locked-down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The sheets are reviewed by a Lieutenant and Captain.

events.title: Inmate Observation Checks at MCC New York SHU
events.description: Staff members conducted regular 30-minute observation checks on inmates held in the Special Housing Unit under continuous locked-down status, as documented on multiple check sheets for different tiers (G, H, I, J, K).

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 6, 2019.
It details a strict observation protocol requiring inmates in locked-down status to be visually checked at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are for multiple tiers (G, H, I, J, K) within the Special Housing Unit.
Each sheet is reviewed and signed off by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
No specific inmate or staff member names are legibly recorded in the provided text excerpts; the fields contain signatures or initials that are not clearly decipherable.
